org.vngx.jsch

Class JSch

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vngx.jsch.JSch

  • public final class JSch
extends Object
    Factory for creating instances of Session and provides some general static methods for working with the vngx-jsch library.
    Author:
    Atsuhiko Yamanaka, Michael Laudati

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String VERSION
      Constant client version "vngx-jsch-0.9-1.44" for vngx-jsch library (sent to SSH server during initial connection).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JSch()
      Private constructor to prevent direct instantiation of singleton.

    • Field Detail

      • VERSION

        public static final String VERSION
        Constant client version "vngx-jsch-0.9-1.44" for vngx-jsch library (sent to SSH server during initial connection). The first version number represents the library version; the second version number represents the JSch version the code base is forked from.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • JSch

        public JSch()
        Private constructor to prevent direct instantiation of singleton. RM20121227: change to public

    • Method Detail

        Returns the singleton instance of JSch.
        Returns:
        singleton instance

      • createSession

        public Session createSession(String username,
                             String host)
                      throws JSchException
        Creates a new instance of Session for the specified host and username. The default standard SSH port 22 will be used for connecting.
        Parameters:
        username -
        host -
        Returns:
        session
        Throws:
        JSchException

      • getHostKeyRepository

        public HostKeyRepository getHostKeyRepository()

      • getVersion

        public static String getVersion()
        Returns the client version of the vngx-jsch library. The version String is passed to the SSH server during the opening connection.
        Returns:
        client version String

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger()
        Returns the Logger instance to use for logging.
        Returns:
        logger instance

      • setLogger

        public static void setLogger(Logger logger)
        Sets the Logger instance to use for logging. Setting the logger to null turns off all internal logging.
        Parameters:
        logger - to use
